text:
Once again, the Shiv Senais behind the cancellationof Ghulam Ali’s visit.

A music launch event in Mumbai where Pakistani ghazal singer Ghulam Ali was due to attend on Friday was cancelled on Wednesday following opposition from the Shiv Sena which had earlier forced the cancellation of his concerts here and in Pune.

“The event was going to happen this Friday at ‘The Club’ in Andheri but now it is not happening. It has been cancelled,” TV show host-turned-filmmaker Suhaib Ilyasi said. Mr.Ilyasi said Mr.Ali, 75, had cancelled his visit to Mumbai.

Mr.Ali was to have arrived here on Thursday to attend the music launch of “Ghar Wapsi”, a movie directed by Mr.Ilyasi, the next day. He has sung a patriotic song in the movie apart from acting in it.

Mr.Ilyasi said a member of the organising committee had gone to ‘The Club’ to deposit the money but claimed he was told, “your booking has been cancelled”.

“No reason was given. It is unfortunate that this incident is happening.

“Even Ghulam Ali Sahab is aware of this and he is feeling sad about this,” Mr.Ilyasi said.

Mr.Ilyasi claimed that the local police and the Shiv Sena had threatened the organisers, asking them to cancel the event.

When contacted, an official at The Club said there was no such booking. — PTI
title: Ghulam Ali event in Mumbai cancelled
